thobe.widgets.inputSlider

Class InputSlider<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • thobe.widgets.inputSlider.InputSlider<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InputDoubleSlider, InputIntegerSlider

    public abstract class InputSlider<T>
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Abstract class that represents a template for a widgets which are a combination of a text-field and a slider.
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setNoCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed

        public void setNoCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed(boolean noCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed)
        Use this method to enter/ leave the 'noCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed' mode. Within this mode changes of the slider only will be committed to the attached listeners if the mouse-button where released. Changes while the mouse is pressed won't be propagated to the listeners.
        Parameters:
        noCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed - - true to enable the 'noCommitValueChangeWhenMousePressed'-mode, false to disable this mode.

      • setTickSpacing

        public void setTickSpacing(T tickSpacing)
        Spacing/ resolution used to compute valid values. This is important if continuous mode is enabled (setEnableContinuousMode()).
        Parameters:
        tickSpacing -

      • setEnableContinuousMode

        public void setEnableContinuousMode(boolean enable)
        Enable/ disable the continuous slider mode. Not enabled: values that does not match a value that is a multiple of tickspacing will be rounded to the nearest value that matches this restriction. Enabled: all values are allowed.
        Parameters:
        enable -
